text: (exciting music)
- [Narrator] USA. UK.
Germany. Brazil.

Location is just one of 30,000
factors the NFL considers
when crafting the season schedule.
As soon as the Super Bowl ends,

the NFL starts running a
complex algorithm to analyze

potential schedules until
it finds the ideal one,
relying on Amazon EC2 Spot Instances
to power its scheduling permutations.

Spot Instances are unused EC2
capacity and are available

at up to a 90% discount
compared to on-demand prices.

Over the last 10 years, the
NFL has leveraged 400,000

Amazon EC2 Spot Instances
to run one million

scheduling permutations, all
while saving $20 million.

To ensure it gets maximum
value from Spot Instances,
the NFL diversifies its instant selection,
using over 20 different instance types.

The NFL also runs its
scheduling jobs at night

when there is greater
availability of Spot Instances,
leveraging the Spot Placement Score tool

to find the ideal locations
with the capacity it needs.
If Spot Instances can do this for the NFL,
imagine what it can do for your business.
